articles.title: The 30/60/90 AI Plan: 5 Benefits To ‘Right-Size’ Work Technology
articles.description: Learn why experts say the 30/60/90 AI plan slows the pace of putting AI into employees' hands and mitigates chaos, confusion and stress plaguing the American workforce.
articles.content: Critics contend that many kinks still need to be ironed out before AI can live up to its promise. One of the biggest criticisms is the rush to push AI everywhere in a bid to outpace Chinese rivals. Some AI startups are adopting China’s grueling ‘9-9-... [6701 chars]

articles.title: Valuation comfort sparks fresh buying in IT stocks
articles.description: Information technology stocks rebounded on Monday, with the NSE IT index jumping 2.3%, as investors deemed recent weakness excessive. Analysts believe most negative factors are priced in, suggesting a potential bottom for the sector. Despite a cautious outlook, selective opportunities exist for medium- to long-term investors.
articles.content:
Mumbai: Information technology stocks rebounded on Monday, emerging from oversold conditions, as investors judged the recent weakness to be excessive.
The NSE IT index jumped 2.3%, posting its best gains in a month, while the Nifty gained 0.7%. TCS, ... [4314 chars]

articles.title: Entergy hits all-time high as CEO says in talks for large Louisiana data centers
articles.description: Entergy reaching a new all-time intraday high, and CEO Phillip May said multiple technology companies are seeking to construct large data centers in northern Louisiana.

articles.title: Ex-Tesla board member reveals how he's playing the EV boom
articles.description: "Whoever wins this technology battle is likely to have the most valuable vehicle company in the world," former Tesla board member Steve Westly said.
articles.content: There's one specific trend set to define the automotive industry, according to investor and former Tesla board member Steve Westly: self-driving vehicles. And he says investors should take note. "Waymo and autonomous vehicles are the future, flat out... [3732 chars]

articles.title: Ministers welcome new loans that will ‘kickstart’ business innovation
articles.description: RBS said the loans could boost industries across Scotland in areas such as gaming, health technology, life sciences, fintech and robotics.
articles.content:
Ministers have welcomed plans by the Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) for a new type of loan for high-growth businesses, saying it will help “kickstart” business innovation in Scotland.
From next year, Scottish firms will be able to secure borrowing agai... [4021 chars]

articles.title: Pacifist Japan Starts Investing in Defense Startups
articles.description: Boosting military spending encourages technology useful during war and peace.
articles.content:
Near the Japanese city of Nagoya, Takumi Yamaguchi pulls on a motorcycle helmet and sprints along an asphalt track before releasing a drone that looks like a 6-foot-long model airplane. It crashes shortly after takeoff.
Yamaguchi’s startup, AirKamuy,... [561 chars]
